intro: Buglossoides arvensis subsp. arvensis, commonly known as field bugloss, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant produces clusters of blue or purple flowers, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its characteristic appearance. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
